description: From Pygmalion, from Ancient Greek Πυγμαλίων (Pugmalíōn), from Phoenician 𐤐𐤏𐤌𐤉𐤕𐤍‎ (pʿmytn /puġ‘mayatun/), from Phoenician 𐤐𐤌𐤉𐤉𐤕𐤍‎ (pmyytn /pumayyatun/).

entries.meaning: One who acts as the legendary Greek sculptor Pygmalion (who was granted the wish of having life given to a sculpture of his which he fell deeply in love with), as in George Bernard Shaw's Pygmalion in which he sometimes refers to his main character (Henry Higgins) as Pygmalion Higgins.
